    Introduction

    The Verifiable Credential Registry (VCR) is a cloud-based system (repository of information and a set of services) that collects and maintains information on all types of credential schemas, the issuers of those credentials and verifiers of credential claims.

    ATB Ventures has already designed and developed the required database and data pipelines for the Verifiable Credential Registry.

    1.1. The definitions of terms

    Credential

    A digital assertion containing a set of Claims made by an Entity about itself or another Entity. Credentials are a subset of Identity Data.

    Claim

    An assertion about an Attribute of a subject. Examples of a claim include: date of birth, height, government ID number, or postal address - all of which are possible attributes of an individual.

    Credential Definition

    A machine-readable definition of the semantic structure of a Credential based on one or more Schemas.

    Schema

    A machine-readable definition of the semantics of a data structure. Schemas are used to define the Attributes used in one or more Credential Definitions.

    Trust Anchor

    In cryptographic systems with hierarchical structure, a trust anchor is an authoritative entity for which trust is assumed and not derived. In the case of identity, it is an issuer who is considered by a verifier to be authoritative for a particular set of claims or credentials.

    Verifiable Credential

    A Credential that includes a proof from the Issuer. Typically this proof is in the form of a digital signature.

    Internal user

    Any member of the data / engineering / product team from ATB Ventures. Even though the team can be a user of the application, a different role might be applied to an individual (e.g. Admin role)

    1.2 Useful Links

    Requirements

    Developers

    2.1 Installation/Running The Project

    Please see the Readme.md

    2.2 Code Walkthrough

    Main Entryfile

    Code samples

    main.ts;

async function bootstrap() {
    const app = await NestFactory.create(AppModule, { bufferLogs: true });
    const port = process.env.PORT;

    SwaggerConfig(app);

    app.enableCors();

    app.setGlobalPrefix('api/v1');

    app.useLogger(await app.resolve(Logger));

    app.useGlobalGuards(new RequestInterceptor());
    app.useGlobalInterceptors(new ResponseInterceptor());
    app.useGlobalPipes(
        new ValidationPipe({
            whitelist: true,
            forbidNonWhitelisted: true,
            transform: true,
            disableErrorMessages: process.env.NODE_ENV === 'production',
        })
    );

    await app.listen(port);
}

    SwaggerConfig(app);

    Swagger is not accessable in the deployed application, but can be accessed locally. See swagger.ts.

    app.setGlobalPrefix('api/v1');

    This global pre-fix is set on every endpoint in the api. It can easily be removed or updated.

    app.useLogger(await app.resolve(Logger));

    This logger is intended for use during development.

    app.useGlobalGuards(new RequestInterceptor());

    A network header is required on alomost every endpoint in the application. This global guard/interceptor will check the header on each incoming request to ensure it is valid.

    app.useGlobalInterceptors(new ResponseInterceptor());

    The data response from Big Query comes in the form of an array, and after calling SET/INSERT the response is an empty array. This response interceptor formats all of the responses to be a uniform response, and to provide a useful messages in the case of an error.

    app.useGlobalPipes(
        new ValidationPipe({
            whitelist: true,
            forbidNonWhitelisted: true,
            transform: true,
            disableErrorMessages: process.env.NODE_ENV === 'production',
        })
    );

    The global validation pipes check all incoming data.

    whitelist: true

    This tells the application to check any incoming requests against a dto for the proper key/value types.

    forbidNonWhitelisted: true

    This rejects any requests in which the params or body do match the specified DTO.

    transform: true

    This allows the proper parsing/transformation of incoming data, as specified by the DTO. ie: string -> number.

    Base Query Service

    Code samples

    
  async createAndExecuteQuery(
    params: any,
    query: string,
    types?: any,
  ): Promise<any[]> {
    this.logger.verbose(`\n\n\tPARAMS:\n\t${JSON.stringify(params)}\n\n`);
    this.logger.verbose(query);

    const [job] = await this.bigquery.createQueryJob({
      query,
      params,
      types,
    });

    this.logger.log(`Job ${job.id} started.`);

    const [rows] = await job.getQueryResults();

    return rows;
  }

    The Base Query Service is an abstracted service which is used throughout the application in order to build/execute queries. We make use of the Node.js Big Query npm package.

    The createAndExecute query function takes 2 required params and 1 optional.

    1. params: This is an object in which the key/value pairs will be used in order to securely execute dynamic queries. Please see the documentation for further explaination: https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/parameterized-queries

    2. query: This is the query string. Any dynamic params will be included as "@param-name", and will be matched to the passed in parameters.

    3. types: In the case of intentionally passing any null value as a parameter to Big Query, the param "types" must also be defined and included in the job. These types must be formatted according to Big Query type specifications.

    Controller(s)

    Code samples

    @ApiTags('public')
@UseInterceptors(ClassSerializerInterceptor)
@Controller()
export class PublicController {
    private readonly logger = new Logger(PublicController.name);
    constructor(private readonly publicService: PublicService) {}

    @Get('/issuers')
    async getIssuerMetadata(
        @Headers('network') network: string,
        @Query() query: IssuerMetadataViewParamsDTO
    ): Promise<IssuerQueryRO[]> {
        this.logger.log(LogAction.EXTERNAL_GET_ISSUER);
        return this.publicService.getIssuerMetadata(query, network);
    }
}

    @ApiTags('public')

    This tag is used for dynamically building the swagger documentation

    @UseInterceptors(ClassSerializerInterceptor)

    This implements the class validator package

    @Headers('network') network: string

    Extract the network header to use in the query

    @Query() query: IssuerMetadataViewParamsDTO

    Validate and extract the request params to be used as query filters

    getIssuerMetadata(query, network)

    Pass the request to the service layer

    Service(s)

    Code samples

    
  async getIssuerMetadata(
    params: IssuerMetadataViewParamsDTO,
    network: string,
  ): Promise<IssuerQueryRO[]> {
    return await this.createAndExecuteQuery(
      { ...params, network },
      this.publicQuery(this.dataset.PUBLIC, this.table.ISSUER_METADATA, params),
    );
  }

    The service layer extends the abstracted Base Query Service, and will format the queries/types/params before calling "createAndExecuteQuery".

    this.createAndExecuteQuery(params= { ...params, network }, query= this.publicQuery(this.dataset.PUBLIC, this.table.ISSUER_METADATA, params), types= optional type definition);

    INSERT and SET with BigQuery

    Code samples

    
  validateLocation(dataset: string): string {
    return `CALL ${dataset}.validate_province_country(@province_id, @country_id )`;
  }

  insertIssuerPhone(dataset: string): string {
    return `
      CALL ${dataset}.insert_transient_issuer_phone
      (
      @network,
      @issuer_did,
      @phone_number,
      @phone_ext,
      @phone_type_id,
      @validation_approver,
      @active,
      @created_by,
      @modified_by
      )`;
  }

    Big Query is an OLAP datawarehouse and does not support the types of constraints that would be present on an OLTP, or, transactional database (ie Postgres). Big Query is excellent for performing complicated queries but since there are no foreign key or duplicate constraints on the tables any validation prior to update/insert must be handled manually.

    There are two POST and two PATCH enddpoints which INSERT and SET data into the tables. The inssertIssuerPhone and insertIssuerLocation functions will CALL a routine in BigQuery prior to insert to perform validation for the province_id, country_id and phone_type_id columns (these are acting as forgein keys to their respective tables) and also to check the that the values meet the unique requirement. The unique constraint for locations: ['suite', 'street_number', 'street_name', 'city', 'province_id', 'country_id', 'postal_code'] and the uniqe constraints for phone number are: 'phone_number', 'phone_ext', 'phone_tyope_id'

    The SET statements are preceded by a routine CALL as well, to validate the FK.

    2.3 Authentication

    # With shell, you can just pass the correct header with each request

  curl "api_endpoint_here" \
--header 'x-apikey: DxHm1ytSxmNNtopmnh2qZwj5KhInNQZWr8ANR0g7NW7dUAGO'

    Make sure to replace key with your API key.

    VCR uses an API keys to allow access to the internal API.

    Authorization: { x-apikey: <key> }

    You must replace key with your personal API key.

    2.4 Headers

    # With shell, you can just pass the correct header with each request

  curl "api_endpoint_here" \
--header 'x-apikey: DxHm1ytSxmNNtopmnh2qZwj5KhInNQZWr8ANR0g7NW7dUAGO'
--header 'network: <network-name>'

    Make sure to replace network-name with a valid network ledger.

    VCR uses an a network header to define which ledger to write and read from.

    This is required on all requests except for:

    • internal/countries
    • internal/countries/:id/provinces
    • internal/phone-types

    { network: <network-name> }

    You must replace key with your personal API key.

    User Guide - Endpoints

    BaseURL(s):

    • local: https://localhost:8080/vcr/api/v1
    • sb: https://sb-api.oliu.id/vcr/api/v1
    • dev: https://dev-api.oliu.id/vcr/api/v1
    • test: https://test-api.oliu.id/vcr/api/v1

    2.1 Public (GET)

    Issuers Metadata:

    • endpoint: /issuers
    • params:
      • required: null
      • optional:
      • query-params:
      • offset: number
      • limit: number
      • issuer_name: string (partial match)
    • headers:
      • required: network (exact match)
    • auth: null
    • body: null

    Credential Definitions:

    • endpoint: /credential-definitions
    • params:
      • required: null
      • optional:
      • query-params:
        • offset: number
        • limit: number
        • issuer_name: string (partial match)
        • issuer_did: string (exact match)
        • attribute_names: (array of strings - partial match)
        • credential_definition_name: (string - partial match)
    • headers:
      • required: network (exact match)
    • auth: null
    • body: null

    Schemas:

    • endpoint: /schemas
    • params:
      • required: null
      • optional:
      • offset: number
      • limit: number
      • issuer_name: string (partial match)
      • issuer_did: string (exact match)
      • attribute_names: array of strings (partial match)
      • schema_name: string (partial match)
      • schema_tx_id: string (exact match)
    • headers:
      • required: network (exact match)
    • auth: null
    • body: null

    2.2 Internal (GET)

    Countries:

    • endpoint: /internal/countries
    • params:
      • required: null
      • optional:
      • offset: number
      • limit: number
    • headers: null
    • auth: x-apikey
    • body: null

    Provinces:

    • endpoint: /internal/countries/:id/provinces
    • params:
    • required:
    • url_params: :id === country_id
    • optional: null
    • headers: null
    • auth: x-apikey
    • body: null

    Phone-Types:

    • endpoint: /internal/phone-types
    • params:
      • required: null
      • optional: null
    • headers: null
    • auth: x-apikey
    • body: null

    Issuers:

    • endpoint: /internal/issuers
    • params:
    • required: null
    • optional:
      • offset: number
      • limit: number
      • legal_name: string (partial match)
    • headers:
      • required: network (exact match)
    • auth: x-apikey
    • body: null

    Issuer by issuer_did:

    • endpoint: /internal/issuers/:issuer_did
    • params:
      • required:
      • url_params: issuer_did
    • headers:
      • required: network (exact match)
    • auth: x-apikey
    • body: null

    Transactions by issuer_did:

    • endpoint: /internal/transactions/:issuer_did
    • params:
      • required:
      • url_params: issuer_did
    • headers:
    • required: network (exact match)
    • auth: x-apikey
    • body: null

    2.3 Internal (POST)

    Phone Number:

    • endpoint: /internal/issuers/:issuer_did/phone
    • params:
      • required:
      • url_params: issuer_did
    • headers:
      • required: network (exact match)
    • auth: x-apikey
    • body:
    {
  phone_type: number (req'd, must be a valid phone_type_id),
  phone_number: string (req'd, 10-12 length),
  phone_ext: string (optional),
  validation_approver: false (optional),
  active: true (optional)
}

    note: phone types must be unique according to all three values (ie: not all three can match a previous entry, but two can match)

    Location:

    • endpoint: /internal/issuers/:issuer_did/address
    • params:
      • required:
      • url_params: issuer_did, id
    • headers:
    • required: network (exact match)
    • auth: x-apikey
    • body:
    {
  suite: string (optional),
  street_number: string (req'd),
  street_name: string (req'd),
  city: string (req'd),
  province_id: string (req'd - must be valid province_id and match country_id),
  country_id: string (req'd - must be valid country_id and match province_id),
  postal_code: string (req'd),
  validation_approver: false (optional),
  active: true (optional)
}

    note: location must be unique according to suite (ie: same address can be inserted with different suite number)

    2.4 Internal (PATCH)

    Issuer:

    • endpoint: /internal/issuers/:issuer_did
    • params:
      • required:
      • url_params: issuer_did
    • headers:
      • required: network (exact match)
    • auth: x-apikey
    • body:
    {
  brand_name: string,
  legal_name: string,
  trusted_score: number,
  validation_approver: boolean,
  email: string
  }

    Phone Number:

    • endpoint: /internal/issuers/:issuer_did/phone/:id
    • params:
      • required:
      • url_params: issuer_did, id
    • headers:
      • required: network (exact match)
    • auth: x-apikey
    • body:
    {
  phone_type: number (optional - must be a valid phone type),
  phone_number: string (optional),
  phone_ext: string (optional),
  validation_approver: false (optional),
  active: true (optional)
}

    Location: (PATCH)

    • endpoint: /internal/issuers/:issuer_did/phone/:id
    • params:
      • required:
      • url_params: issuer_did, id
    • headers:
    • required: network (exact match)
    • auth: x-apikey
    • body:
    {
  suite: string (optional),
  street_number: string (optional),
  street_name: string (optional),
  city: string (optional),
  province_id: string (optional, req'd if country_id is included - must be valid province_id and match country_id),
  country_id: string (optional, req'd if province_id is included - must be valid country_id and match province_id),
  postal_code: string (optional),
  validation_approver: false (optional),
  active: true (optional)
}

    Verifiable Credential Registry v1.0

    Scroll down for code samples, example requests and responses. Select a language for code samples from the tabs above or the mobile navigation menu.

    API for Big Query based Verifiable Credential Registry

    Base URLs:

    public

    PublicController_getIssuerMetadata

    Code samples

    GET /issuers

    Parameters

    Name In Type Required Description
    network header string true none
    limit query number false none
    offset query number false none
    issuer_name query string false none
    issuer_did query string false none

    Example responses

    200 Response

    [
  {
    "network": "IDRAMP_OCI",
    "issuer_did": "Xa2gmxvm3B9BucSFFKeJQa",
    "issuer_name": "Oliu",
    "issuer_legal_name": "ATB",
    "email": "example@email.com",
    "website": "https://example.com",
    "trusted_score": 0,
    "modified_date": {
      "value": "2022-06-09T16:05:24.000Z"
    },
    "phone_number": {
      "phone_number": "555-555-5555",
      "phone_ext": "",
      "phone_type": ""
    },
    "locations": {
      "street_number": "1",
      "street_name": "test",
      "suite": "B",
      "city": "Victoria",
      "province": "BC",
      "postal_code": "V8W1N3",
      "country": "Canada"
    },
    "total_count": 1048
  }
]

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK none Inline

    Response Schema

    Status Code 200

    Name Type Required Restrictions Description
    anonymous [IssuerQueryRO] false none none
    network string true read-only none
    issuer_did string true read-only none
    issuer_name string true read-only none
    issuer_legal_name string true read-only none
    email string true read-only none
    website string true read-only none
    trusted_score number true read-only none
    modified_date string true read-only none
    phone_number PhoneNumber true read-only none
    phone_number string true read-only none
    phone_ext string true read-only none
    phone_type string true read-only none
    locations Locations true read-only none
    street_number string true read-only none
    street_name string true read-only none
    suite string true read-only none
    city string true read-only none
    province string true read-only none
    postal_code string true read-only none
    country string true read-only none
    total_count number true read-only none
    This operation does not require authentication

    PublicController_getSchema

    Code samples

    GET /schemas

    Parameters

    Name In Type Required Description
    network header string true none
    limit query number false none
    offset query number false none
    issuer_name query string false none
    issuer_did query string false none
    attribute_names query array[string] false none
    schema_name query string false none
    schema_txn_id query string false none

    Example responses

    200 Response

    [
  {
    "seq_no": 5000,
    "issuer_did": "UrLu13JebieuQfX8WDgJ8z",
    "network": "INDICIO_DEMONET2",
    "subledger": "domain",
    "txn_name": "SCHEMA",
    "ledger_size": 5007,
    "signature": {
      "req_signature_type": "ED25519",
      "req_signature_value": [
        "3ZeUpxQHnmbeHn3EE2UiSAw848KSPiDhuJ2wa3nhUooxxQTkRCQ8LnFjmGxwhqMUKXg45CDggZuJvTE5c43KXySm"
      ]
    },

    PublicController_getCredentialDefinition

    Code samples

    GET /credential-definitions

    Parameters

    Name In Type Required Description
    network header string true none
    limit query number false none
    offset query number false none
    issuer_name query string false none
    issuer_did query string false none
    attribute_names query array[string] false none
    credential_definition_name query string false none
    claim_def_txn_id query string false none

    Example responses

    200 Response

    [
  {
    "seq_no": 5000,
    "issuer_did": "UrLu13JebieuQfX8WDgJ8z",
    "network": "INDICIO_DEMONET2",
    "subledger": "domain",
    "txn_name": "CLAIM_DEF",
    "ledger_size": 5001,
    "signature": {
      "req_signature_type": "ED25519",
      "req_signature_value": [
        "3ZeUpxQHnmbeHn3EE2UiSAw848KSPiDhuJ2wa3nhUooxxQTkRCQ8LnFjmGxwhqMUKXg45CDggZuJvTE5c43KXySm"
      ]
    },
    "claim_def_txn_id": "6Vs7ABAWVW5SXg3XP3CNdi:3:CL:4998:tag",
    "issuer_details": {
      "issuer_did": "Xa2gmxvm3B9BucSFFKeJQa",
      "issuer_name": "Oliu",
      "email": "email@example.com",
      "website": "http://www.example.com",
      "trusted_score": 0,
      "phone_number": {
        "phone_number": "555-555-5555",
        "phone_ext": "",
        "phone_type": ""
      },
      "locations": {
        "street_number": "1",
        "street_name": "test",
        "suite": "B",
        "city": "Victoria",
        "province": "BC",
        "postal_code": "V8W1N3",
        "country": "Canada"
      }
    },
    "txn_time_epoch": 1620721662,
    "txn_time": {
      "value": "2022-06-09T16:05:24.000Z"
    },

    Readme

    Index

    • Tech Stack

    • Getting Started

      • Installation

      • Running
      • Updating Docs

    • Development

      • Pre Commit Hook
      • Building Production Container

    • Tests

    • Roadmap

    Tech Stack

    • Server: NestJs
    • Gateway: Apigee
    • Database: Big Query
    • Authorization: Api Key
    • Docs: Slate/Widdershins/Swagger
    • Testing: Postman/Newman

    Getting Started

    Installation

    Clone the project

      git clone git@github.com:ATB-Ventures/atb-ventures-cred-registry.git

    Go to the project directory

      cd atb-ventures-cred-registry

    Install dependencies

    Ensure you are using the correct node version (16)

      cd api && npm install

    Environment Variables

    Copy the .env.example file and add any missing variables from root:

     cp .env.example .env

    You will also need to manually update your api/.env file with the following:

    
PORT=8080
NODE_ENV=development
PROJECT=cred-registry

GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS=application_default_credentials.json
GCLOUD_PROJECT=atbv-sb-credential-registry

GCLOUD_BIGQUERY_PUBLIC_DATASET=dait_atb_ventures_credential_registry_sb

GCLOUD_BIGQUERY_PUBLIC_ISSUER_METADATA_TABLE=credential_registry_issuer_metadata_view
GCLOUD_BIGQUERY_PUBLIC_CLAIM_DEF_TABLE=credential_registry_claim_def_view

GCLOUD_BIGQUERY_PUBLIC_CRED_REGISTRY_TABLE=credential_registry_view

GCLOUD_BIGQUERY_PRIVATE_DATASET_TRANSIENT=dait_atb_ventures_credential_registry_transient_sb
GCLOUD_BIGQUERY_PRIVATE_DATASET_PERMANENT=dait_atb_ventures_credential_registry_sb

GCLOUD_BIGQUERY_COUNTRIES_TABLE=country
GCLOUD_BIGQUERY_PROVINCE_TABLE=province
GCLOUD_BIGQUERY_PHONE_TYPE_TABLE=phone_type
GCLOUD_BIGQUERY_ISSUERS_TABLE=transient_issuer_view
GCLOUD_BIGQUERY_TRANSIENT_ISSUERS_TABLE=transient_issuer
GCLOUD_BIGQUERY_TRANSACTIONS_TABLE= credential_registry_ledger_metadata_view
GCLOUD_BIGQUERY_ISSUER_PHONE_TABLE=transient_issuer_phone
GCLOUD_BIGQUERY_ISSUER_LOCATION=transient_issuer_location
GCLOUD_BIGQUERY_TRANSIENT_PHONE_TYPE=transient_phone_type
GCLOUD_BIGQUERY_TRANSIENT_COUNTRY=transient_country
GCLOUD_BIGQUERY_TRANSIENT_PROVINCE=transient_province
API_URL=http://localhost:8080/api

    Local GCP Authentication

    In order to generate the GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS json, please complete the following steps:

    • ensure gcloud sdk is installed locally
    • set the project the project id locally

    <project_id> = atbv-sb-app-01

    gcloud config set project <project_id>
    • generate auth credentials for the default project:
    gcloud auth application-default login
    • You will be prompted to finish authenticating in the browser
    • Go back to your terminal and copy the file path that has printed in your console
    • Copy the generated file to your local projetc directory:
    cp <your-specific-path>.config/gcloud/application_default_credentials.json ./api

    * note you will need to close and restart the container in order for the changes to take effect

    Running With Docker

    First time/When you want to build again: (from root of the project)

      make build-local

    Subesquently/When you want to run the previous build: (from root of the project)

      make run-local
    ## Logs

    Use these command to print the container logs

      make local-api-logs

      make local-docs-logs
    ## Workspace

    Use these command to exec into the container(s)

     make local-api-workspace

     make local-docs-workspace
    ## Close

    To close and stop the running container

    make close-local

    Documentation

    Run Docs

    The documentation will build/run when you initially run the project. If you need to run the documentation independently, then run:

    First time:

    make build-docs

    Subsequently:

    make run-docs

    The documentation can be accessed at http://localhost:4567.

    Update Docs

    To ensure the documentation is current with the latest api changes run:

    make update-docs

    Please update the docs/source/includes .md files to align with any code changes

    note: this command requires that the project is running locally

    note: the _api.md file is automatically generated, so any changes to this file will be overwritten.

    Development

    Pre Commit Hook

    This should be automatically configured. If you have issues, from the project root, try running:

    npx husky install

    To override this hook, append -n to your commit

    Building Production Container

    (You should not need to do this as it should happen automatically upon pushing to github. This would be for testing the prod build locally in case of build errors.) To build the production container

    cd api && docker build -t vcr-api-prod .

    To run the production container

     cd api && docker run -p 5000:5000 vcr-api-prod

    Tests

    Tests run automatically in the repository, and rely on the Dokcerfile.test and env.test. These are specifically configured for running in the pipeline, and should not be used locally.

    Instead, just run:

    make run-test-pipeline

    This will run the tests inside of your local development container and will rely on the env vars set in env.local

    Roadmap

    • Public GET endpoints with service to query data from credential registry bq database

    • Private POST endpoints for issuers to create new Credentials Definitions and insert data into the bq transient tables

    • Private Patch endpoints for admins to make changes to Credential Definitions and update the transient bq table

    • Apigee gateway

    • Auth guards and authorization with google identity platform

    Typescript
